# Scott House (Kingstree, South Carolina)

| locmapin    = South Carolina#USA
| built       = c.
| builder     = Scott, Joseph
| added       = June 28, 1982
| area        =
| mpsub       =
| refnum      = 82004797
}}
Scott House, also known as the Scott-Hauenstein House, is a historic home located at Kingstree, Williamsburg County, South Carolina.  It was built about 1843, and is a two-story, three-bay, frame building, sheathed in weatherboard, with a side-gabled roof and brick foundation. The front fa√ßade features a "Carolina" or "rain porch." Its builder was Joseph Scott, a wealthy planter, trustee of the Kingstree Academy, and politician. It is the oldest on-site house in Kingstree.
It was listed in the National Register of Historic Places in 1982.
